data.title: A List of Countries That Drive on the Left and Right Side
data.meta_description: The world is divided by countries that drive on the right side of the road, and countries that drive on the left. Learn which countries drive on each side.
data.text:
The world is divided by countries who drive on the right side of the road, and countries who drive on the left

As shown on the map below, the majority of the world drives on the right side of the road; however, about 35 percent of countries drive on the left side â€“ many being former British colonies.

In countries that drive on the right side of the road, the cars are typically built so that the driver sits on the left-hand side of the car. The opposite is true for countries driving on the left, where cars are built so that the driver sits on the right-hand side.

Check out the map below to see which countries drive where!

Map of Countries that Drive on the Right vs. Left

Green colored countries drive on the right, orange countries drive on the left.

15 COUNTRIES THAT DRIVE ON THE LEFT

Australia

Bangladesh

British Virgin Islands

Cayman Islands

Dominica

Fiji

Guyana

Hong Kong

India

Japan

Kenya

New Zealand

South Africa

United Kingdom

Zimbabwe

15 COUNTRIES THAT DRIVE ON THE RIGHT

Aruba

Bahrain

Canada

China

Dominican Republic

Finland

Germany

Haiti

Iceland

Korea

Mexico

Norway

Philippines

Taiwan

United States

Click here for a full list of countries that drive on the right and left

Source: www.worldstandards.eu

CAR LEASING AND FINANCING FOR EXPATS

IAS offers Expats full-service personal transportation solutions for financing, purchasing and leasing without a local credit history and worldwide car rental. Our financing, purchasing and leasing programs provide cost savings ranging from hundreds to thousands of dollars on a vehicle, saving our customers valuable time and resources while building a much-needed local credit history.
